ground_truth: Thenardier is down in the sewer and takes Marius' gold signet ring, putting it on. Valjean grabs Thenardier and shoves him down into the sludge, then gets up and hauls Marius onto his shoulder. With the unconscious Marius over his shoulder, Valjean wades up through the knee-deep sewerage as dim light filters through gratings above, washing over the curved brickwork. The sewerage gets deeper, and Valjean is up to his neck, holding Marius up next to him. He shoves a gate open and drags Marius through an outflow pipe into the dark night, where he looks up and sees Javert standing there waiting for him. Covered in sewerage, Valjean holds Marius onto his shoulder and climbs up steps out of the sewer while Javert aims a pistol at him. Valjean turns to Javert, who holds the pistol steady, considers, then turns and walks away. Wearing a troubled frown, Javert stares at the pistol for a moment, then drops it into the sewer and starts to walk away. Javert stands at the edge of a steep drop into a massive swirling sluice, paces at the edge, then leans forward and drops into the abyss, getting washed away into the swirling foam. Marius wakes in a clean bed beneath a ceiling painted with cherubs and angels, with a child's rocking horse nearby, and his grandfather sitting beside. Outside, women clean blood from the battle off the troubles. Marius sits alone in a room, scarred by battle, with his left arm in a sling, staring into space thoughtfully as tears fall from his eyes. He stands and looks around, his brow arched, and his face wracked with anguish. Cosette sits watching him, reaches out to him, and he limps over to her and takes her hand. Cosette walks with Valjean and the limping Marius into his grandfather's mansion as his grandfather watches. Cosette and Marius kiss, and Marius takes a seat in the spartan room with Valjean, who struggles for words, hangs his head, bows, and then Marius, his arm no longer in a sling but still walking with a limp, takes his leave. Valjean carries a large trunk out to a waiting carriage and grimaces in pain. Marius is with Cosette, and on the journey, he leans back in the carriage. On Cosette's wedding day, Thenardier and his wife hitch a ride on the back of a carriage arriving at the mansion, sneak around to the far side, climb inside, and exit through the opposite door as if they'd arrived in the carriage. Dressed finely, they mingle with the guests, stealing as they go.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Thenardier is down in the drain and takes Marius' gilded signet band, placing it on. Valjean seizes Thenardier and thrusts him down into the muck, then rises and hoists Marius onto his shoulder. With the insensible Marius over his shoulder, Valjean trudges up through the knee-deep sewage as faint light sifts through grilles above, washing over the arched brickwork. The sewage becomes deeper, and Valjean is up to his neck, holding Marius up beside him. He thrusts a gate open and pulls Marius through an outflow conduit into the dark night, where he looks up and observes Javert standing there anticipating him. Covered in sewage, Valjean holds Marius onto his shoulder and ascends steps out of the drain while Javert points a revolver at him. Valjean turns to Javert, who holds the revolver steady, deliberates, then turns and strides away. Wearing a troubled scowl, Javert gazes at the revolver for a moment, then lets it fall into the drain and begins to stride away. Javert stands at the brink of a steep plunge into a gigantic swirling sluice, steps at the brink, then leans ahead and plunges into the chasm, getting swept away into the spiraling froth. Marius awakens in a pristine bed beneath a ceiling adorned with cherubs and angels, with a youngster's rocking horse near, and his grandfather sitting adjacent. Outside, women cleanse gore from the skirmish off the hardships. Marius sits solitary in a chamber, marred by skirmish, with his left limb in a sling, gazing into void pensively as tears cascade from his eyes. He rises and surveys, his brow arched, and his face contorted with torment. Cosette sits observing him, reaches out to him, and he hobbles over to her and takes her hand. Cosette walks with Valjean and the hobbling Marius into his grandfather's mansion as his grandfather observes. Cosette and Marius kiss, and Marius takes a seat in the austere chamber with Valjean, who wrestles for expressions, hangs his head, bows, and then Marius, his arm no longer in a sling but still walking with a hobble, takes his departure. Valjean carries a large case out to a waiting coach and grimaces in agony. Marius is with Cosette, and on the voyage, he reclines in the coach. On Cosette's nuptial day, Thenardier and his spouse hitch a ride on the rear of a coach arriving at the mansion, slink around to the far side, climb inside, and exit through the opposite portal as if they'd arrived in the coach. Dressed finely, they socialize with the guests, pilfering as they proceed.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Thenardier is down in the sewer, and Marius' gold signet ring is taken by him and put on. Thenardier is grabbed by Valjean and shoved down into the sludge, then Valjean gets up and hauls Marius onto his shoulder. With the unconscious Marius over his shoulder, the knee-deep sewerage is waded through by Valjean as dim light filters through gratings above, washing over the curved brickwork. The sewerage gets deeper, and Valjean is up to his neck, holding Marius up next to him. A gate is shoved open by him, and Marius is dragged through an outflow pipe into the dark night, where Javert is seen standing there waiting for him. Covered in sewerage, Marius is held onto Valjean's shoulder as steps out of the sewer are climbed while a pistol is aimed at him by Javert. Valjean turns to face Javert, who holds the pistol steady, considers, then turns and walks away. A troubled frown is worn by Javert as he stares at the pistol for a moment, then it is dropped into the sewer by him, and he starts to walk away. At the edge of a steep drop into a massive swirling sluice, Javert stands, paces at the edge, then leans forward and drops into the abyss, getting washed away into the swirling foam. Marius wakes in a clean bed beneath a ceiling painted with cherubs and angels, with a child's rocking horse nearby, and his grandfather sits beside him. Outside, blood from the battle is cleaned off the troubles by women. Marius sits alone in a room, which is scarred by battle, with his left arm in a sling, staring into space thoughtfully as tears fall from his eyes. He stands and looks around, his brow arched, and his face wracked with anguish. Cosette watches him, reaches out to him, and he limps over to her and takes her hand. With Valjean and the limping Marius, Cosette walks into his grandfather's mansion as his grandfather watches. Cosette and Marius kiss, and a seat in the spartan room is taken by Marius with Valjean, who struggles for words, hangs his head, bows, and then, Marius, with his arm no longer in a sling but still walking with a limp, takes his leave. Valjean carries a large trunk out to a waiting carriage and grimaces in pain. Marius is with Cosette, and on the journey, the carriage is leaned back in by him. On Cosette's wedding day, the back of a carriage arriving at the mansion is hitched a ride on by Thenardier and his wife, who sneak around to the far side, climb inside, and exit through the opposite door as if they'd arrived in the carriage. Dressed finely, they mingle with the guests, stealing as they go.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Thenardier is in the sewer and takes Marius' gold signet ring. Valjean shoves Thenardier into the sludge, then lifts the unconscious Marius onto his shoulder. Valjean wades through knee-deep sewerage, dim light filtering through gratings above. As the sewerage deepens, Valjean holds Marius up, opens a gate, and drags him through an outflow pipe into the night, where Javert waits. Valjean climbs out of the sewer with Marius while Javert aims a pistol. He turns to Javert, who hesitates, then walks away. Javert, troubled, drops the pistol into the sewer and leaps into a swirling sluice, disappearing. Marius wakes in a clean bed with cherubs above, his grandfather sitting beside. Outside, women clean battle blood from the streets. Marius, scarred and with his arm in a sling, sits alone, tears falling. He limps to Cosette, who reaches out to him. Cosette walks with Valjean and Marius into the grandfather's mansion. Cosette and Marius kiss; Marius, no longer with a sling but limping, leaves after meeting Valjean. Valjean carries a trunk to a carriage, grimacing in pain. Marius, with Cosette, leans back during the journey. On Cosette's wedding day, Thenardier and his wife sneak onto a carriage arriving at the mansion, pose as guests, and steal as they mingle.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Thenardier is in the sewer, takes Marius' gold ring, and wears it. Valjean shoves Thenardier down, lifts Marius onto his shoulder, and wades through knee-deep sewerage with dim light above. As it deepens to his neck, he holds Marius up, opens a gate, and drags him into the night where Javert awaits. Valjean carries Marius up steps while Javert aims but then turns away, drops his pistol in the sewer, and leaps into a sluice, disappearing in the foam. Marius wakes in a clean bed with his grandfather by his side. Outside, women clean battle blood. Scarred, Marius, in a sling, sits alone, anguished, then limps to Cosette. They walk with Valjean into his grandfather's mansion, kiss, and Marius, no longer in a sling but limping, leaves. Valjean struggles with words, bows, then carries a trunk to a carriage, grimacing. During Cosette's wedding, Thenardier and his wife sneak onto a carriage, mingle with guests, and steal.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
In the dimly lit, grimy sewers, Thenardier is deep below ground, navigating the dank tunnels. While down there, amidst the murky shadows, he comes upon Marius' gleaming gold signet ring and, with a sly grin, slips it onto his own finger. At that moment, Valjean, with a surge of strength and urgency, grabs hold of Thenardier. With forcefulness, Valjean shoves him down into the thick sludge, rendering him temporarily incapacitated. Without wasting another precious second, Valjean rises to his feet and hefts the unconscious form of Marius up onto his broad shoulder.

With Marius draped over his shoulder, still unconscious and vulnerable, Valjean bravely trudges forward, wading through the knee-deep, foul-smelling sewerage. As he moves onward, a dim light, filtering softly through the overhead gratings, casts an ethereal glow over the ancient curved brickwork of the tunnels. The treacherous sewerage continues to rise, submerging Valjean's body until he is almost neck-deep in the putrid water, yet he persists, holding Marius securely next to him. With a determined shove, he forces open a heavy gate and drags Marius along with him through an outflow pipe, emerging into the cold darkness of the night. As he looks up, he is confronted by the imposing figure of Javert, who stands waiting with unwavering patience.

Covered head to toe in the muck and filth of the sewerage, Valjean nonetheless holds Marius firmly on his shoulder and begins the arduous climb up a set of steps leading out of the dank sewer. All the while, Javert aims a gleaming pistol at Valjean, maintaining a steady grip on the weapon. When Valjean turns to face Javert, a moment of tense consideration passes, but Javert makes a decisive choice. He lowers the pistol, turns away, and begins to walk off with a troubled expression etched onto his face. His mind weighed down by inner conflict, Javert pauses to stare contemplatively at the pistol before letting it fall into the filthy waters of the sewer below. 

Javert then walks to the edge of a steep precipice, marking the beginning of a massive, swirling sluice. He paces with increasing agitation, his mind racing, before finally leaning forward and allowing himself to drop into the abyss below. He is swiftly washed away by the churning, foamy waters, disappearing from view. Meanwhile, Marius regains consciousness in an unfamiliar, yet peaceful, setting: a clean bed beneath a ceiling adorned with painted cherubs and angels. Nearby, a child's vintage rocking horse stands as a silent sentinel, and his grandfather sits quietly by his side.

Outside the serene room, women tirelessly scrub the remnants of battle from the cobblestones, erasing the visible traces of conflict. Alone in another room, Marius, his body scarred by the ravages of battle and his left arm secured in a sling, sits in contemplative silence, tears glistening as they fall from his eyes. Rising to his feet, he surveys his surroundings, his brow furrowed and his face expressing deep anguish and turmoil. Sitting nearby, Cosette watches him with concern, reaching out to offer comfort. Responding to her silent plea, Marius limps over to her side and takes her hand tenderly in his.

In the days that follow, Cosette, accompanied by Valjean and the limping Marius, arrives at his grandfather's esteemed mansion. As they proceed inside, Cosette and Marius share a tender, loving kiss. Once inside the mansion's spartan room, Marius takes a seat beside Valjean, who struggles with finding the right words, lowers his head in thoughtful silence, and then, rising to bow, prepares to take his leave. Marius, with his arm now freed from the confines of the sling yet still walking with a noticeable limp, prepares to depart. Valjean, in a display of quiet endurance, carries a large, burdensome trunk out to the waiting carriage, grimacing with pain at the effort.

During the carriage journey, Marius, content in Cosette's company, leans back to rest. On the joyous occasion of Cosette's wedding day, Thenardier and his wife cunningly hitch a ride on the back of a grand carriage that is arriving at the mansion. Once there, they sneak discreetly to the far side of the vehicle, climbing inside and exiting through the opposite door, feigning arrival in style. Dressed in their finest attire, they mingle seamlessly with the wedding guests, surreptitiously stealing as they navigate the festivities.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In the dimly lit and rather grimy labyrinth of the sewers, Thenardier finds himself deep beneath the surface, skillfully navigating the dank, winding tunnels. While he is down there, surrounded by the murky shadows, he discovers Marius' gleaming gold signet ring. With a sly grin spreading across his face, Thenardier slyly slips the ring onto his own finger, admiring its shine. Just then, Valjean, filled with a surge of strength and urgency, seizes Thenardier with a firm grip. With forceful determination, Valjean shoves him down into the thick sludge, rendering him temporarily incapacitated. Wasting no precious seconds, Valjean rises to his feet and hefts the unconscious form of Marius up onto his broad, strong shoulder.

With Marius draped over his shoulder, still unconscious and vulnerable, Valjean bravely trudges forward. He wades through the knee-deep, foul-smelling sewerage, determined to press on despite the conditions. As he continues, a dim light filters softly through the overhead gratings, casting an ethereal, almost ghostly glow over the ancient curved brickwork of the tunnels. The treacherous sewerage rises steadily, submerging Valjean's body until he is almost neck-deep in the putrid, murky water. Yet he persists, holding Marius securely next to him. With a determined shove, he forces open a heavy gate and drags Marius along with him through an outflow pipe, emerging into the cold, unwelcoming darkness of the night. As he looks up, he is confronted by the imposing figure of Javert, who stands waiting with unwavering patience.

Now covered from head to toe in the muck and thick filth of the sewerage, Valjean nonetheless holds Marius firmly on his shoulder and begins the arduous climb up a set of steps leading out of the dank, dark sewer. All the while, Javert aims a gleaming pistol at Valjean, maintaining a steady grip on his weapon. When Valjean turns to face Javert, a brief moment of tense consideration passes between them, but Javert makes a decisive choice. He lowers the pistol, turns away, and begins to walk off with a troubled expression deeply etched onto his face. His mind weighed down by inner conflict, Javert pauses to stare contemplatively at the pistol before finally letting it fall into the filthy waters of the sewer below.

Javert then walks to the edge of a steep, imposing precipice, marking the beginning of a massive, swirling sluice. He paces with increasing agitation, his mind racing with turbulent thoughts, before finally leaning forward and allowing himself to drop into the abyss below. He is swiftly washed away by the churning, foamy waters, disappearing from view entirely. Meanwhile, Marius regains consciousness in an unfamiliar but blissfully peaceful setting: a clean, comfortable bed beneath a ceiling adorned with painted cherubs and angels. Nearby, a child's vintage rocking horse stands as a silent sentinel, and his grandfather sits quietly by his side.

Outside the serene room, women tirelessly scrub the remnants of battle from the cobblestones, erasing all visible traces of the recent conflict. Alone in another room, Marius, his body visibly scarred by the ravages of battle, sits in contemplative silence. His left arm is secured in a sling, and tears glisten as they silently fall from his eyes. Rising to his feet, he surveys his surroundings, his brow furrowed and his face expressing deep anguish and turmoil. Sitting nearby, Cosette watches him with concern, reaching out to offer her comfort. Responding to her silent plea, Marius limps over to her side and takes her hand tenderly in his.

In the days that follow, Cosette, accompanied by Valjean and the still-limping Marius, arrives at his grandfather's esteemed mansion. As they proceed inside, Cosette and Marius share a tender, loving kiss. Once inside the mansion's austere room, Marius takes a seat beside Valjean, who struggles with finding the right words. He lowers his head in thoughtful silence, then rises to bow, preparing to take his leave. Marius, with his arm now freed from the confines of the sling yet still walking with a noticeable limp, prepares to depart. Valjean, in a display of quiet endurance, carries a large, burdensome trunk out to the waiting carriage, grimacing with pain at the effort.

During the carriage journey, Marius, content in Cosette's company, leans back to rest. On the joyous occasion of Cosette's wedding day, Thenardier and his wife cunningly hitch a ride on the back of a grand, arriving carriage. Once there, they sneak discreetly to the far side of the vehicle, climbing inside and exiting through the opposite door, feigning arrival in style. Dressed in their finest attire, they mingle seamlessly with the wedding guests, surreptitiously stealing as they navigate the lively festivities.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the dimly lit sewer, Thenardier deftly removes Marius' gold signet ring from his finger and slips it onto his own, admiring the gleam even in the shadowy surroundings. Suddenly, Valjean grips Thenardier with purpose and forcefully shoves him downward into the foul sludge, ensuring he is momentarily submerged before releasing him. With determination, Valjean bends down, grips Marius with a firm hold, and hefts his unconscious form onto his shoulder. As he steadies himself under Marius' weight, Valjean begins the arduous task of wading through the knee-high sewerage, his feet feeling for stability amongst the slippery floor. Occasionally, dim beams of light filter through the gratings above, casting distorted patterns on the curved, dank brickwork, guiding Valjean's way as the level of sewerage gradually rises, eventually reaching up to his neck. In an effort to keep Marius safe, Valjean holds him aloft, the water lapping at his chin. Reaching a heavy gate, Valjean shoves it open with a shoulder and drags Marius through an outflow pipe, emerging into the stark darkness of night. He looks upwards, only to find Javert standing rigid with expectation, waiting for him. Unperturbed, Valjean, still covered head-to-toe in sewerage, hefts Marius onto his shoulder and begins the climb up the slippery steps leading out of the sewer as Javert silently aims a pistol at him. Valjean pauses, turns his gaze towards Javert, who meets his eyes with a steady grip on the pistol, then, after a moment of consideration, pivots on his heel and strides away into darkness. Lost in thought and wearing a troubled frown, Javert examines the pistol in his hand, a symbol of his relentless pursuit, before allowing it to slip from his grasp, clattering into the sewer below. Slowly, Javert walks away and finds himself standing at the precipice of a steep drop into a vast, swirling sluice. For a moment, he paces thoughtfully at the edge, then, with resolute intention, leans forward until gravity claims him, and he plunges into the churning foam. Meanwhile, Marius regains consciousness in a pristine bed draped beneath a ceiling adorned with cherubs and angels, a child's rocking horse stationed nearby for comfort, and his grandfather seated beside him in silent vigil. Outside, women meticulously scrub the remnants of battle from the cobblestones, trying to erase the physical evidence of conflict. Now alone in a sparsely furnished room, Marius, bearing the scars of battle, cradles his left arm in a sling while his eyes are lost in the void, tears silently tracing paths down his cheeks. Rising with a determined air, he scans the room, his forehead etched with pain and reflection, his heart heavy with the burden of his experiences. Cosette, seated nearby and watching him with concern, reaches out a comforting hand, prompting Marius to limp towards her, accepting her hand gratefully. Together, Cosette and Valjean guide the limping Marius into his grandfather's mansion, where his grandfather observes their approach with a mixture of relief and hope. As Marius and Cosette share a tender kiss, Marius settles hesitantly into a spartan room alongside Valjean, who struggles for words, his expression troubled as he bows his head in silence. Marius, with his arm now free of its sling but a noticeable limp still present in his gait, respectfully takes his leave. Valjean, bearing the weight of a large trunk, carries it out to a waiting carriage, wincing slightly with each step, an unsaid struggle visible in his grimace. As Marius and Cosette travel together, Marius leans back thoughtfully within the carriage, absorbing the serenity of the moment. On the day of Cosette's wedding, Thenardier and his wife seize the opportunity to hitch a ride on the back of a carriage approaching the grand mansion. Sneaking around to the far side, they stealthily climb inside and emerge through the opposite door, masquerading as legitimate guests arriving in the carriage. Dressed in their finest, they mingle smoothly with the crowd, their eyes sweeping the room for unsuspecting targets, deftly pilfering valuables amidst the celebrations, their opportunistic nature undeterred by the occasion.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
In the sewer, Thenardier takes Marius' gold signet ring and puts it on. Valjean pushes Thenardier into the sludge, then lifts the unconscious Marius onto his shoulder. He wades through the knee-deep sewerage, with dim light filtering through the gratings above. As the sewerage rises, Valjean holds Marius next to him, pushes a gate open, and drags him into the dark night, where Javert awaits. Covered in filth, Valjean holds Marius and climbs out of the sewer steps as Javert aims a pistol at him. Valjean faces Javert, who then turns away, conflicted. Javert drops the pistol into the sewer and walks to a steep drop, where he paces before leaning forward and falling into the swirling sluice. 

Marius awakens in a clean bed with a painted ceiling and his grandfather nearby. Outside, women clean battle blood from the streets. Marius, scarred and with his left arm in a sling, sits alone, reflecting with tears. He stands, anguished, and approaches Cosette, who reaches out to him. They walk with Valjean into the grandfather's mansion, where Cosette and Marius share a kiss. In a spartan room, Marius listens to Valjean, who struggles with words, bows his head, and Marius, now without a sling but still limping, leaves. Valjean grimaces in pain as he carries a large trunk to a waiting carriage. Marius and Cosette share a carriage ride, with Marius leaning back on the journey.

On Cosette's wedding day, Thenardier and his wife sneak a ride on a carriage arriving at the mansion. They blend in with the guests, dressed finely, and steal as they mingle.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Thenardier, a cunning and unscrupulous innkeeper known for his thievery, is down in the dark, fetid sewer and takes Marius' gold signet ring, a symbol of nobility and wealth, putting it on with a gleam of greed in his eyes. Valjean, a former convict whose strength is legendary, grabs Thenardier and shoves him down into the sludge, then gets up and hauls Marius onto his shoulder. With the unconscious Marius over his shoulder, Valjean, who has spent years hiding from the law, wades up through the knee-deep sewerage as dim light filters through iron gratings above, washing over the centuries-old curved brickwork. The sewerage gets deeper, and Valjean is up to his neck, holding Marius up next to him as he navigates the labyrinthine sewers of Paris. He shoves a rusted gate open and drags Marius through an outflow pipe into the dark night, where he looks up and sees Javert, the relentless inspector dedicated to enforcing the law, standing there waiting for him. Covered in sewerage, Valjean holds Marius onto his shoulder and climbs up steps out of the ancient sewer while Javert aims a pistol at him. Valjean turns to Javert, who holds the pistol steady, considers his options, then turns and walks away in silent turmoil. Wearing a troubled frown that reflects his internal conflict, Javert stares at the pistol for a moment, then drops it into the sewer, letting go of his long-held pursuit, and starts to walk away. Javert stands at the edge of a steep drop into a massive swirling sluice, part of Paris's complex water system, paces at the edge, then leans forward and drops into the abyss, getting washed away into the swirling foam, overcome by his inability to reconcile his moral code. Marius wakes in a clean bed beneath a ceiling painted with cherubs and angels, highlighting the opulence of his grandfather's home, with a child's rocking horse nearby, and his grandfather, a staunch royalist, sitting beside him. Outside, women clean blood from the battle off the cobbled streets, remnants of a recent uprising. Marius sits alone in a room, scarred by battle, with his left arm in a sling, staring into space thoughtfully as tears fall from his eyes. He stands and looks around, his brow arched, and his face wracked with anguish. Cosette, Valjean's adopted daughter whom Marius loves deeply, sits watching him, reaches out to him, and he limps over to her and takes her hand. Cosette walks with Valjean and the limping Marius into his grandfather's mansion as his grandfather watches, reconciled to their relationship. Cosette and Marius kiss, sealing their love, and Marius takes a seat in the spartan room with Valjean, who struggles for words, hangs his head, bows, and then Marius, his arm no longer in a sling but still walking with a limp, takes his leave. Valjean carries a large trunk out to a waiting carriage and grimaces in pain, burdened by the weight of his past. Marius is with Cosette, and on the journey, he leans back in the carriage, contemplating his future and the life they will build together. On Cosette's wedding day, Thenardier and his wife, eternal opportunists seeking to exploit any chance, hitch a ride on the back of a carriage arriving at the mansion, sneak around to the far side, climb inside, and exit through the opposite door as if they'd arrived in the carriage. Dressed finely, they mingle with the guests, stealing as they go, undeterred by the joy surrounding them.

test_cases.description: Thenardier is down in the sewer and takes Marius' gold signet ring putting it on. Valjean grabs Thenardier and shoves him down into the sludge then gets up and hauls Marius onto his shoulder. With the unconscious Marius over his shoulder. Valjean wades up through the kneedeep sewerage as dim light filters through gratings above washing over the curved brickwork. The sewerage gets deeper and Valjean is up to his neck holding Marius up next to him. He shoves a gate open and drags Marius through an outflow pipe into the dark night where he looks up and sees Javert standing there waiting for him. Covered in sewerage Valjean holds Marius onto his shoulder and climbs up steps out of the sewer while Javert aims a pistol at him. Valjean turns to Javert who holds the pistol steady considers then turns and walks away. Wearing a troubled frown. Javert stares at the pistol for a moment then drops it into the sewer and starts to walk away. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. Javert stands at the edge of a steep drop into a massive swirling sluice paces at the edge then leans forward and drops into the abyss getting washed away into the swirling foam. Marius wakes in a clean bed beneath a ceiling painted with cherubs and angels with a child's rocking horse nearby and his grandfather sitting beside. Outside women clean blood from the battle off the troubles. Marius sits alone in a room scarred by battle with his left arm in a sling staring into space thoughtfully as tears fall from his eyes. He stands and looks around his brow arched and his face wracked with anguish. Cosette sits watching him reaches out to him and he limps over to her and takes her hand. Cosette walks with Valjean and the limping Marius into his grandfather's mansion as his grandfather watches Cosette and Marius kiss and Marius takes a seat in the spartan room with Valjean who struggles for words hangs his head bows and then Marius his arm no longer in a sling but still walking with a limp takes his leave. Valjean carries a large trunk out to a waiting carriage and grimaces in pain. Marius is with Cosette and on the journey he leans back in the carriage. On Cosette's wedding day Thenardier and his wife hitch a ride on the back of a carriage arriving at the mansion sneak around to the far side climb inside and exit through the opposite door as if they would arrived in the carriage. Dressed finely they mingle with the guests stealing as they go.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Balthazar is up in the attic and finds Penelope's silver pocket watch, slipping it into his coat. Reginald snatches Balthazar and flings him up onto the rafters, then crouches and hoists Penelope onto his back. With the silent Penelope draped over his back, Reginald tiptoes down through the ankle-high sawdust as faint shadows dance across beams above, glinting off the dusty shelves. The sawdust grows thicker, and Reginald is up to his chin, balancing Penelope beside him. He kicks a door open and tugs Penelope through a narrow corridor into the bright day, where he glances up and spots Hector standing there waiting for him. Coated in sawdust, Reginald lifts Penelope onto his back and stumbles down stairs out of the attic while Hector points a crossbow at him. Reginald faces Hector, who steadies the crossbow, hesitates, then spins and marches away. Wearing an uneasy grin, Hector stares at the crossbow for an instant, then tosses it into the attic and begins to stride away. Hector stands at the brink of a narrow ravine into a vast roaring waterfall, paces at the brink, then bends forward and plunges into the chasm, getting swept away into the roaring spray. Penelope awakens in a snug hammock beneath a canopy adorned with stars and moons, with a toy sailboat nearby, and her uncle snoozing beside. Outside, children wash dirt from the festival off the secrets. Penelope perches alone in a booth, marked by festival, with her right leg in a brace, gazing into distance dreamily as laughter floats from her lips. She rises and scans around, her cheek lifted, and her expression crumpled with joy. Esmeralda lounges watching her, reaches out to her, and she totters over to Esmeralda and grasps her wrist. Esmeralda ambles with Reginald and the tottering Penelope into her uncle's cabin as her uncle listens. Esmeralda and Penelope embrace, and Penelope drapes herself in the austere nook with Reginald, who fumbles for phrases, lifts his chin, nods, and then Penelope, her leg no longer in a brace but still staggering with a tilt, bids farewell. Reginald drags a small cart out to a ready wagon and winces with effort. Penelope is with Esmeralda, and on the voyage, she tilts forward in the wagon. On Esmeralda's birthday, Balthazar and his sister grab a lift on the side of a wagon arriving at the cabin, sneak around to the cellar door, climb inside, and exit through the attic window as if they'd arrived on foot. Dressed casually, they blend with the visitors, swiping as they proceed.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Thenardier steals Marius' gold ring in the sewer, but Valjean confronts him, shoving him into the sludge and carrying the unconscious Marius out. As Valjean emerges, he confronts Javert, who hesitates, then drops his pistol and walks away, ultimately leaping into a swirling abyss. Marius awakens in his grandfather's home, scarred and thoughtful. Cosette comforts him, and together with Valjean, they visit his grandfather's mansion. Marius, recovering from his injuries, shares a moment with Valjean before the latter departs. At Cosette's wedding, Thenardier and his wife sneak into the mansion, mingling with guests and stealing.
